alert.note: Alert for Concho; Kimble; McCulloch; Menard; Schleicher; Sutton; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 7:56AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SCHLEICHER...NORTHWESTERN KIMBLE...SOUTHEASTERN TOM GREEN...NORTHWESTERN MCCULLOCH...MENARD... CONCHO AND NORTHEASTERN SUTTON COUNTIES THROUGH 845 AM CDT... At 754 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Paint Rock to 9 miles west of Live Oak to Eldorado. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Eldorado, Menard, Paint Rock, Eden, Melvin, Vancourt, Eola, Pear Valley, Doole, Mereta, Salt Gap, Millersview, Fort Mckavett, Live Oak, Camp Sol Mayer, Us-83 Near The Menard- Concho County Line, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 380 And Ranch Road 381, Vick, The Intersection Of Us- 83 And Ranch Road 1929, and The Intersection Of Us- 190 And Ranch Road 2084. This includes Interstate 10 near Mile Marker 420. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for west central Texas.

area.areaDesc: Concho; Kimble; McCulloch; Menard; Schleicher; Sutton; Tom Green
